question: Sculptures of the Mathura School of Art, which flourished in the early centuries of the Christian Era, are made out of which of the following materials?
explanation: The main traditional centre of production in this school was Mathura, and other important centres were Sarnath and Kosambi. The material used in this school was the spotted red sandstone. This art reached its peak during the Gupta period in 6th or 7th century.
